name: Garlic, Basil, and Bacon Deviled Eggs
author: JoeLactoseFree
summary: Deviled eggs made with fresh basil, garlic, and bacon! These are some of the best deviled eggs you will ever put in your mouth. Once your friends try them, they will beg you to make them again and again!
ingredients: ½ cup finely chopped fresh basil
¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
directions: Place the eggs into a saucepan in a single layer and fill with water to cover the eggs by 1 inch
Cover the saucepan and bring the water to a boil over high heat
Remove from the heat and let the eggs stand in the hot water for 15 minutes
Cool the eggs under cold running water
Halve the eggs lengthwise and scoop the yolks into a bowl
Mash the yolks together with pressed garlic with a fork
Cook the bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat until evenly browned, about 10 minutes
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate; chop once cool
Add to the mashed egg yolks
Stir the basil, mayonnaise, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper into the mixture until evenly mixed
Fill the egg white halves with the mixture; sprinkle each stuffed egg with a bit of paprika
